intro: Achaeta, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that typically open in the morning and close in the evening. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found growing along roadsides and in disturbed soils. Achaeta has heart-shaped leaves and produces long, winding vines that can climb or trail along the ground. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological studies.
